content: @Wayne Kubick has set up a stream for #Endpoint Discovery , which is an issue that a lot of adopters raise. In particular, for a session tomorrow US time, we would like feedback here https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/252301-Endpoint-Discovery/topic/ONC.20Forum.20Session from Non-US participants - what is happening in your country around registering public end-points for health data availability (from what I hear, the answer is mostly nothing but I'll be very happy to be proven wrong) - thanks

If you take FHIR out of the equation, I would say its in pretty good shape in DK. While the API's are listed in the public space, you can't use them unless your company has a proper clearance (private practitioners mostly) or act on behalf of one of the public actors ... and most of the API's are focused on use by practitioners
